topic.title: Front Matter and Back Matter - XML Fragment

body.p: In the merged map file, the frontmatter topic references are wrapped in an frontmatter element that has the class bookmap/frontmatter. Then, the referenced content is marked with the attribute is-frontmatter="true":
body.codeblock: <bookmap xmlns:ditaarch="http://dita.oasis-open.org/architecture/2005/" ...> <oxy:front-page class="- front-page/front-page "> ... </oxy:front-page> <opentopic:map xmlns:ot-placeholder="http://suite-sol.com/namespaces/ot-placeholder" class="- toc/toc "> ... <frontmatter xmlns:dita-ot="http://dita-ot.sourceforge.net/ns/201007/dita-ot" class="- map/topicref bookmap/frontmatter "> ... <topicref class="- map/topicref " href="#unique_1" type="concept"> ... </frontmatter> </opentopic:map> <concept xmlns:dita-ot="http://dita-ot.sourceforge.net/ns/201007/dita-ot" class="- topic/topic concept/concept " id="unique_1" is-frontmatter="true" topicrefclass="- map/topicref bookmap/bookabstract " nd:nd-id="concept-1" oid="concept-1">

body.note: The process also applies for the backmatter topic references inside backmatter element with bookmap/backmatter class and referenced content with is-backmatter="true" attribute both in merged map and merged html files.
